text: Kōwa (弘和) was a Japanese era name (年号, nengō, lit. year name) of the Southern Court during the Nanboku-chō period after Tenju and before Genchū. This period started in February 1381 and ended in April 1384.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Nengō" in Japan encyclopedia, p. 566.
